title: The boards confuse me, is it a tank meta, an assassin meta, a sated meta, or an ADC meta?
body:
Make up your mind, or realize we are actually seeing a fair amount of diversity right now. Every class has members that are performing quite well right now, and all though I will admit I'm not happy with the necessity and strengths of ADC's right now, Riot's been slowly bringing them in lane with each patch.

Yes, there's a few individual outliers here that are too weak or too strong, but the general balance of the classes is pretty good right now.

It's an ADC meta, just like every meta since this game began. 

-Assassins are strong because they're the ones who can deal with ADCs. 
-Tanks aren't individually strong, but they peel for ADCs and can lock the enemy down.
-CERTAIN supports, like Janna/Thresh, are strong because they can also keep assassins off ADCs.
-ADCs are showing up in roles that really hasn't been encouraged or possible before. There's something to be said for variety, but not at the cost of balance. 
-APCs, barring certain DISGUSTING outliers, have fallen by the wayside in favor of ADCs for damage.
-Objectives have never been more important, nor so weak. ADCs, hands down, are the best class for taking objectives. Even better than junglers.
Wasn't Season 5 _not _ an ADC meta until the marksman update? Notoriously so?

You see mages AND assassins midlane. You see tanks, fighters, the occasional assassin and mage top lane. You see mostly fighters, tanks, bruisers and some mages jungle. And there's a few marksman in every lane. Tell me, have you ever seen a prevalent and meta pick for a bot lane carry other than ADC? Have you ever seen a meta recently where a team may or may not have an ADC instead of a guarantee?

Also,  when someone calls "ADC" pregame instead of a lane, where do you think they are going?
Well, before the Marksman update Morde was pretty OP bot lane. Especially with a tanky support.
that was a single heavily overtuned outliner, a exeption to the rule due to horrible balanceing.

> [{quoted}](name=WingsofGulgazor,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hKbs7ELE,comment-id=00080002,timestamp=2016-03-10T22:33:26.700+0000)

I think you need to reflect on what you just said... If when marksmen were weak, they were still performing their intended role well enough to remain mandatory on each team, then they were not at all weak by any honest definition.  An equivalent statement would be something like "Tanks aren't always meta.  When they're not burst assassinating carries, they're still necessary to engage and peel."  Sieging and backline DPS is the marksmen role, like engaging and peeling is a tank's role.  If they are outperforming champions in other roles, then that is a problem that shouldn't be overlooked.

> [{quoted}](name=WingsofGulgazor,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hKbs7ELE,comment-id=00080002,timestamp=2016-03-10T22:33:26.700+0000)
>Supports have been meta in the same way as adc's have. In fact you could say that adc's are strong because they go well with supports because there's not enough gold to make that player useful as anything other then a support.

No, this isn't an accurate comparison at all.  Support is a necessary position, like top lane is a necessary position.  You either need to send someone to support somewhere (it honestly shouldn't need to be bot lane) or do something like double jungle with the junglers spending a lot of their time leeching xp in lanes, because there are only 4 gold flows per team.  Supports also come in several different viable varieties, tank, utility/healing, mage, etc.  "Ranged AD Carry bot lane" is a much more specific role than "support".  An equivalent would be if "AP assassin jungle" were mandatory for years.  There is no other case in league where a position has ever been so dominated by one narrow role as the "ADC" situation.

I think it's the "stupid op champs" meta. There are a couple champs of each class that are stupid OP that use up all the bans. People get against those champs and think it's X meta, depending on which champ they played against.
